facts.fact_text: South Korea reported its largest-ever annual current account surplus in 2025, reaching US$123.05 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: South Korea reported its largest-ever annual current account surplus in 2025. The surplus reached US$123.05 billion

facts.fact_text: The 2025 current account surplus exceeded the previous record of $105.1 billion set in 2015.

evidences.evidence_text: The surplus reached US$123.05 billion, exceeding both the previous record of $105.1 billion set in 2015

facts.fact_text: The 2025 current account surplus exceeded the central bank’s forecast of $115 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: The surplus reached US$123.05 billion, exceeding both the previous record of $105.1 billion set in 2015 and the central bank’s forecast of $115 billion.

facts.fact_text: The South Korean government issued $3 billion in overseas foreign exchange stabilization bonds.

evidences.evidence_text: Further bolstering sentiment, the government successfully issued $3 billion in overseas foreign exchange stabilization bonds, the largest single issuance since 2009.

facts.fact_text: The $3 billion bond issuance was the largest single issuance since 2009.

evidences.evidence_text: Further bolstering sentiment, the government successfully issued $3 billion in overseas foreign exchange stabilization bonds, the largest single issuance since 2009.

facts.fact_text: The bond offering was split into three- and five-year tranches.

evidences.evidence_text: The offering, split into three- and five-year tranches, was tightly priced, signaling strong demand and bolstering confidence in South Korea’s external finances.

evidence.evidence_text: Strong exports, particularly amid a semiconductor upcycle, further reinforced investor confidence.

links.source_ref: government issued $3 billion in overseas foreign exchange stabilization bonds

evidence.evidence_text: While primarily aimed at strengthening foreign-exchange reserves, the bond sale helped ease near-term pressure on the currency.
Korean Won Rises on Currency Inflows
